indications.text: potassium chloride oral solution indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .

contraindications.text: dilute prior ( 2.1 , 5.1 ) monitor serum potassium adjust accordingly ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) serum potassium concentration < 2.5 meq/l , intravenous potassium instead oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) treatment hypokalemia : adults : initial doses range 40 to100 meq/day 2 5 divided doses : limit doses 40 meq per dose . total daily dose exceed 200 meq ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : 2 4 meq/kg/day divided doses ; exceed 1 meq/kg single dose 40 meq whichever lower ; deficits severe ongoing losses great , consider intravenous therapy . total daily dose exceed 100 meq ( 2.3 ) maintenance prophylaxis hypokalemia : adults : typical dose 20 meq per day ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : typical dose 1 meq/kg/day . exceed 3 meq/kg/day ( 2.3 )

warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride oral solution , usp light pink orange powder colored speckles available one strength follows : 20 meq ndc # 70069-823-01 pouch . pouch contains 1.5 g potassium chloride ( kcl ) , usp , equivalent potassium 20 meq chloride 20 meq ndc # 70069-823-30 carton 30 pouches ndc # 70069-823-10 carton 100 pouches storage store controlled room temperature , 25°c ( 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15° 30°c ( 59° 86°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp protect light . rx manufactured : somerset therapeutics , llc somerset , nj 08873 manufactured : granules pharmaceuticals inc. , chantilly , va 20151 rev . 09/2024
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients potassium sparing diuretics
name: Potassium Chloride for Oral Solution
indications_original: Potassium Chloride for oral solution is indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications_original: Dilute prior to administration ( 2.1 , 5.1 ) Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosage accordingly ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) If serum potassium concentration is <2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) Treatment of hypokalemia: Adults: Initial doses range from 40 to100 mEq/day in 2 to 5 divided doses: limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. Total daily dose should not exceed 200 mEq ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: 2 to 4 mEq/kg/day in divided doses; not to exceed 1 mEq/kg as a single dose or  40 mEq whichever is lower; if deficits are severe or ongoing losses are great, consider intravenous therapy. Total daily dose should not exceed 100 mEq ( 2.3 ) Maintenance or Prophylaxis of hypokalemia: Adults: Typical dose is 20 mEq per day ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: typical dose is 1 mEq/kg/day. Do not to exceed 3 mEq/kg/day ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium Chloride for Oral Solution, USP is a light pink to orange powder with colored speckles available in one strength as follows:
                  
                  20 mEq
                  
                  
                  NDC# 70069-823-01 pouch. Each pouch contains 1.5 g of potassium chloride (KCl), USP, which is equivalent to potassium 20 mEq and chloride 20 mEq
  
                     
NDC# 70069-823-30 carton of 30 pouches
  
NDC# 70069-823-10 carton of 100 pouches
 
                  
                  
                  
                  
                     Storage
                  
                  
                  Store at Controlled Room Temperature, 25°C (77°F); excursions are permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F). [
  See USP Controlled Room Temperature].
 
                  
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP
                  PROTECT from LIGHT.
                  
                  Rx only
                  
                  
                  
                     Manufactured for:
                     
Somerset Therapeutics, LLC
  
Somerset, NJ 08873
 
                  
                  
                     Manufactured by:
                     
Granules Pharmaceuticals Inc.,
  
Chantilly, VA 20151
 
                  
                  Rev. 09/2024
adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on potassium sparing diuretics
